section.title: Description
section.p: siprintf is a restricted version of sprintf: it has the same arguments and behavior, save that it cannot perform any floating-point formatting: the f, g, G, e, and F type specifiers are not recognized.

section.title: Returns
section.p: siprintf returns the number of bytes in the output string, save that the concluding NULL is not counted. siprintf returns when the end of the format string is encountered.
